skill.name: venue-templates
skill.description: Access comprehensive LaTeX templates, formatting requirements, and submission guidelines for major scientific publication venues (Nature, Science, PLOS, IEEE, ACM), academic conferences (NeurIPS, ICML, CVPR, CHI), research posters, and grant proposals (NSF, NIH, DOE, DARPA). This skill should be used when preparing manuscripts for journal submission, conference papers, research posters, or grant proposals and need venue-specific formatting requirements and templates.
skill.summary: Access comprehensive LaTeX templates, formatting requirements, and submission guidelines for major s...
skill.author: davila7

security_audit.summary: This skill contains legitimate LaTeX templates and Python helper scripts for academic document formatting. The only executable components are standard PDF analysis tools (pdfinfo, pdffonts) used for format validation. All file operations are confined to the skill's directory structure with no network access or sensitive data exposure.

low_findings.title: Subprocess execution for PDF validation
low_findings.description: The validate_format.py script uses subprocess.run() to execute external commands (pdfinfo, pdffonts) for analyzing PDF files. These are standard system utilities for document validation. The commands are hardcoded and use the file path as an argument, which is safe when processing user-specified files.

content.user_title: Get LaTeX templates for journals and conferences
content.value_statement: Researchers spend hours formatting manuscripts to meet journal or conference requirements. This skill provides ready-to-use LaTeX templates and formatting guidelines for major scientific venues including Nature, NeurIPS, NSF, and NIH. It also includes validation scripts to ensure documents meet all requirements before submission.
actual_capabilities: Provides LaTeX templates for 50+ journals (Nature, Science, PLOS, IEEE, Cell Press)
Includes conference paper templates for NeurIPS, ICML, CVPR, CHI, and 20+ more
Offers research poster templates (A0, A1 sizes) using beamerposter, tikzposter
Contains grant proposal templates for NSF, NIH, DOE, and DARPA with required sections
Validates document formatting against venue requirements (page limits, margins, fonts)
Customizes templates with author names, affiliations, titles, and project details
limitations: Templates are starting points and must be verified against current official guidelines
Does not write content for papers or proposals (only formatting)
PDF validation requires poppler-utils installed for full functionality
Some conferences update templates annually requiring manual download of new style files

use_cases.title: First conference paper submission
use_cases.description: Graduate student preparing their first conference paper who needs proper formatting for NeurIPS or ICML submission

use_cases.title: NIH R01 grant application
use_cases.description: Professor preparing an NIH R01 grant proposal who needs the Specific Aims page template and Research Strategy structure

use_cases.title: Journal manuscript preparation
use_cases.description: Postdoc revising a manuscript for Nature or Science who needs to verify page limits and formatting requirements

prompt_templates.title: Find journal template
prompt_templates.prompt: I need to submit a manuscript to Nature. Show me the Nature article template and list the key formatting requirements including page limits, citation style, and figure requirements.

prompt_templates.title: Get conference format
prompt_templates.prompt: What are the formatting requirements for NeurIPS 2025? Show me the template and explain the anonymization requirements for double-blind review.

prompt_templates.title: Grant proposal setup
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me set up an NIH R01 grant template. I need the Specific Aims page format, the 12-page Research Strategy structure, and the biographical sketch requirements.

prompt_templates.title: Validate document
prompt_templates.prompt: Validate my paper against NeurIPS formatting requirements. Check page count, margins, and font specifications using the validation script.

output_examples.input: I need to prepare a Nature article submission about machine learning research
output: Nature Article Template loaded from assets/journals/nature_article.tex
Key requirements: ~3,000 words (excluding Methods/References), single-column format, Times 12pt font, 2.5cm margins, superscript numbered citations
Figures: 300-600 dpi TIFF/EPS/PDF, max width 89mm (single column) or 183mm (double column)
Template includes sections for Title, Authors, Abstract, Introduction, Results, Discussion, Methods, References, Figure Legends

best_practices: Always verify templates against the current year's official author guidelines before submission
Use the validation script to check page counts, margins, and font compliance before submitting
Customize templates early to focus your writing on required sections and format
Check anonymization requirements for conferences (NeurIPS, ICML require double-blind)
anti_patterns: Using outdated templates without checking the current year's guidelines
Manually adjusting margins or font sizes to fit more content (violates requirements)
Submitting without validating page count and format compliance
Forgetting to de-anonymize author information for camera-ready versions

faq.question: Which journals and conferences are supported?
faq.answer: 50+ journals including Nature, Science, PLOS, Cell Press, IEEE, ACM. 20+ conferences including NeurIPS, ICML, CVPR, CHI, KDD, ISMB.

faq.question: Are templates updated annually?
faq.answer: Templates are updated regularly but conferences like NeurIPS change style files yearly. Always verify against official conference websites.

faq.question: Can I use these for grant proposals?
faq.answer: Yes, templates included for NSF Standard Grant, NIH R01/R21, DOE Office of Science, and DARPA BAA responses with required sections.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using validation scripts?
faq.answer: Validation runs locally using pdfinfo/pdffonts. No data is sent anywhere. Files are only read to check formatting compliance.

faq.question: Why does validation require poppler-utils?
faq.answer: poppler-utils provides pdfinfo and pdffonts commands to extract PDF page count and font information. Install via brew (macOS) or apt (Linux).

faq.question: How does this compare to Overleaf templates?
faq.answer: These templates provide the same structure but with additional helper scripts for validation and customization. Overleaf hosts official templates; this skill adds automation.
